tests.title: DocumentDB Cluster Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that data at-rest in encrypted in AWS DocumentDB clusters using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon DocumentDB integrates with AWS KMS and uses a method known as envelope encryption to protect your data. This gives you an extra layer of data security and help meet security compliance and regulations within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Modify DocumentDB cluster at-rest encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: Connect Instance Media Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Connect instances have encryption enabled for media streams being saved on Kinesis Video Stream.
tests.more_info: In Amazon Connect, you can capture customer audio during an interaction with your contact center by sending the audio to a Kinesis video stream. All data put into a Kinesis video stream is encrypted at rest using AWS-managed KMS keys. Use customer-managed keys instead, in order to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Connect instance data storage configuration and enable encryption for media streams

tests.title: Connect Instance Chat Transcripts Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Connect instances have encryption enabled for chat transcripts being saved on S3.
tests.more_info: You can configure Amazon Connect instance to save transcripts for chats to be saved on S3. When you save such data on S3, enable encryption for the data and use a KMS key with desired encrypted level to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Connect instance data storage configuration and enable encryption for chat transcripts

tests.title: Connect Instance Exported Reports Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Connect instances have encryption enabled for exported reports being saved on S3.
tests.more_info: You can configure Amazon Connect instance to save exported reports on S3. When you save such data on S3, enable encryption for the data and use a KMS key with desired encrypted level to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Connect instance data storage configuration and enable encryption for exported reports

tests.title: Connect Instance Call Recording Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Connect instances have encryption enabled for call recordgins being saved on S3.
tests.more_info: You can configure Amazon Connect instance to save recordings for incoming call to be saved on S3. When you save such data on S3, enable encryption for the data and use a KMS key with desired encrypted level to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Connect instance data storage configuration and enable encryption for call recordings

tests.title: Connect Instance Attachments Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Connect instances have encryption enabled for attachments being saved on S3.
tests.more_info: You can configure Amazon Connect instance to save attachments on S3. When you save such data on S3, enable encryption for the data and use a KMS key with desired encrypted level to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Connect instance data storage configuration and enable encryption for  attachments

tests.title: Backup Vault Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon Backup vaults are using AWS KMS Customer Master Keys instead of AWS managed-keys (i.e. default encryption keys).
tests.more_info: When you encrypt AWS Backup using your own AWS KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) for enhanced protection, you have full control over who can use the encryption keys to access your backups.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Backup Vault with desired encryption level

tests.title: Video Stream Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Kinesis Video Streams is using desired encryption level for Data at-rest.
tests.more_info: Server-side encryption is always enabled on Kinesis video streams data. If a user-provided key is not specified when the stream is created, the default key (provided by Kinesis Video Streams) is used. It is recommended to use customer-managed keys (CMKs) for encryption in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Kinesis Video Streams data with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: Connect Wisdom Domain Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Wisdom domains created under Amazon Connect instances are using desired KMS encryption level.
tests.more_info: All user data stored in Amazon Connect Wisdom is encrypted at rest using encryption keys stored in AWS Key Management Service. Additionally, you can provide customer managed KMS keys in order to gain more control over encryption/decryption processes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Amazon Connect Wisdom domains have encryption enabled.

tests.title: Connect Voice ID Domain Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Voice domains created under Amazon Connect instances are using desired KMS encryption level.
tests.more_info: All user data stored in Amazon Connect Voice ID is encrypted at rest using encryption keys stored in AWS Key Management Service. Additionally, you can provide customer managed KMS keys in order to gain more control over encryption/decryption processes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Amazon Voice ID domains have encryption enabled.

tests.title: Exported Findings Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that GuardDuty findings export is encrypted using desired KMS encryption level.
tests.more_info: GuardDuty data, such as findings, is encrypted at rest using AWS owned customer master keys (CMK). Additionally, you can use your use key (CMKs) in order to gain more control over data encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt GuardDuty Export Findings with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.more_info: Amazon Lookout for Equipment encrypts your data at rest with AWS owned KMS key by default. It is recommended to use customer-managed keys instead you will gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Amazon LookoutEquipment Dataset with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Tracker Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Location tracker data is encrypted using desired KMS encryption level
tests.more_info: Amazon Location Service provides encryption by default to protect sensitive customer data at rest using AWS owned encryption keys. It is recommended to use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Amazon Location tracker with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Geoference Collection Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Location geoference collection data is encrypted using desired KMS encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon Location Service provides encryption by default to protect sensitive customer data at rest using AWS owned encryption keys. It is recommended to use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Amazon Location geoference collection with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Model Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Lookout for Vision model data is encrypted using desired KMS encryption level
tests.more_info: By default, trained models and manifest files are encrypted in Amazon S3 using server-side encryption with KMS keys stored in AWS Key Management Service (SSE-KMS). You can also use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt LookoutVision model with customer-manager keys (CMKs) present in your account

tests.title: LookoutMetrics Anomaly Detector Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon LookoutMetrics Anomaly Detector is encrypted using desired KMS encryption level
tests.more_info: Amazon Lookout for Metrics encrypts your data at rest with your choice of an encryption key. If you do not specify an encryption key, your data is encrypted with AWS owned key by default. So use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Amazon LookoutMetrics Anomaly Detector with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Audio Logs Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Lex audio logs are encrypted using desired KMS encryption level
tests.more_info: For audio logs you use default encryption on your S3 bucket or specify an AWS KMS key to encrypt your audio objects. Even if your S3 bucket uses default encryption you can still specify a different AWS KMS key to encrypt your audio objects for enhanced security.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Lex audio logs with customer-manager keys (CMKs) present in your account

tests.title: Forecast Dataset Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Forecast datasets are using desired KMS key for data encryption.
tests.more_info: Datasets contain the data used to train a predictor. You create one or more Amazon Forecast datasets and import your training data into them. Make sure to enable encryption for these datasets using customer-managed keys (CMKs) in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create Forecast datasets using customer-manager KMS keys (CMKs).

tests.title: Forecast Dataset Export Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Forecast exports have encryption enabled before they are being saved on S3.
tests.more_info: In AWS Forecast, you can save forecast reports on S3 in CSV format. Make sure to encrypt these export before writing them to the bucket in order to follow your organizations's security and compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Create Forecast exports with encryption enabled

tests.title: FSx File System Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon FSx for Windows File Server file systems are encrypted using desired KMS encryption level.
tests.more_info: If your organization is subject to corporate or regulatory policies that require encryption of data and metadata at rest, AWS recommends creating encrypted file systems.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for file systems created under Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

tests.title: Firehose Delivery Streams CMK Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Firehose delivery stream are encrypted using AWS KMS key of desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Data sent through Firehose delivery streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing delivery streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead. Use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using desired level for all Firehose Delivery Streams.

tests.title: Kinesis Data Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Kinesis data streams are encrypted using AWS KMS key of desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Data sent to Kinesis data streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead. Use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using desired level for all Kinesis streams

tests.title: SQS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure SQS queues are encrypted using keys of desired encryption level
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.Use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) for all SQS queues.

tests.title: Fraud Detector Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Fraud Detector has encryption enabled for data at rest with desired KMS encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon Fraud Detector encrypts your data at rest with AWS-managed KMS key. Use customer-manager KMS keys (CMKs) instead in order to follow your organizations's security and compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for data at rest using PutKMSEncryptionKey API

tests.title: CloudFront Distribution Field-Level Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that field-level encryption is enabled for your Amazon CloudFront web distributions.
tests.more_info: With Amazon CloudFront, you can enforce secure end-to-end connections to origin servers by using HTTPS. Field-level encryption adds an additional layer of security that lets you protect specific data throughout system processing so that only certain applications can see it.Field-level encryption allows you to enable users to securely upload sensitive information to web servers.
tests.recommended_action: Enable field-level encryption for CloudFront distributions.

tests.title: MSK Cluster Encryption In-Transit
tests.description: Ensure that TLS encryption within the cluster feature is enabled for your Amazon MSK clusters.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK in-transit encryption is an optional feature which encrypts data in transit within your MSK cluster. You can override this default at the time you create the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Enable TLS encryption within the cluster for all MSK clusters

tests.title: MSK Cluster Client Broker Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that only TLS encryption between the client and broker feature is enabled for your Amazon MSK clusters.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK in-transit encryption is an optional feature which encrypts data in transit between the client and brokers. Select the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to encrypt data as it travels between brokers and clients within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Enable only TLS encryption between the client and broker for all MSK clusters

tests.title: Dockerfile Template Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Image Recipe dockerfile templates are encrypted.
tests.more_info: Image Builder now offers a managed service for building Docker images. With Image Builder, you can automatically produce new up-to-date container images and publish them to specified Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) repositories after running stipulated tests. Custom components are encrypted with your KMS key or a KMS key owned by Image Builder.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that container recipe docker file templates are encrypted using AWS keys or customer managed keys in Imagebuilder service

tests.title: Image Recipe Storage Volumes Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Image Recipe storage ebs volumes are encrypted.
tests.more_info: EC2 Image Builder is a fully managed AWS service that makes it easier to automate the creation, management, and deployment of customized, secure, and up-to-date server images that are pre-installed and pre-configured with software and settings to meet specific IT standards.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that storage volumes for ebs are encrypted using AWS keys or customer managed keys in Image recipe

tests.title: Image Builder Components Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Image Builder components are encrypted.
tests.more_info: Build components contain software, settings, and configurations that are installed or applied during the process of building custom images. Tests are run after a custom image is built to validate functionality, security, performance, etc. Custom components are encrypted with your KMS key or a KMS key owned by Image Builder.

data.name: 11.1.5 Network segmentation
data.description: Network access should be physically or logically segregated among the admin area of the cloud computing service provider, user service area, and inter-user service area.

tests.description: Ensures that VPCs have multiple subnets to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: VPCs should be designed to have separate public and private subnets, ideally across availability zones, enabling a DMZ-style architecture.
tests.recommended_action: Create at least two subnets in each VPC, utilizing one for public traffic and the other for private traffic.

tests.description: Ensures that VPCs have multiple subnets to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: VPCs should be designed to have separate public and private subnets, ideally across availability zones, enabling a DMZ-style architecture.

data.name: 12.1.1 Data classification
data.description: Data should be classified and managed on the basis of its type, legal requirements, sensitivity and materiality.

tests.title: ECR Repository Tag Immutability
tests.description: Ensures ECR repository image tags cannot be overwritten
tests.more_info: ECR repositories should be configured to prevent overwriting of image tags to avoid potentially-malicious images from being deployed to live environments.
tests.recommended_action: Update ECR registry configurations to ensure image tag mutability is set to immutable.

data.name: 12.1.3 Data integrity
data.description: Data input/output, data transmission or exchange and data at rest should always be checked for its data integrity.

tests.title: RDS Automated Backups
tests.description: Ensures automated backups are enabled for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides a simple method of backing up RDS instances at a regular interval. This should be enabled to provide an option for restoring data in the event of a database compromise or hardware failure.
tests.recommended_action: Enable automated backups for the RDS instance

tests.title: SQL Server TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures RDS SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to RDS. A parameter group can be used to enforce this connection type.
tests.recommended_action: Create a parameter group that contains the TLS version restriction and limit access to TLS 1.2 or higher
tests.remediation_description: TLS 1.2 will be enabled, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 will be disabled

tests.title: Redshift Cluster Audit Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensure audit logging is enabled for Redshift clusters for security and troubleshooting purposes.
tests.more_info: Redshift clusters should be configured to enable audit logging to log cluster usage information.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Redshift clusters to enable audit logging

tests.title: Lambda Admin Privileges
tests.description: Ensures no Lambda function available in your AWS account has admin privileges.
tests.more_info: AWS Lambda Function should have most-restrictive IAM permissions for Lambda security best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Modify IAM role attached with Lambda function to provide the minimal amount of access required to perform its tasks

results.message: Function does not have admin privileges
Function does not have admin privileges

tests.title: Environment Admin Privileges
tests.description: Ensures no Amazon MWAA environment available in your AWS account has admin privileges.
tests.more_info: Amazon MWAA environments should have most-restrictive IAM permissions for security best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Modify IAM role attached with MWAA environment to provide the minimal amount of access required to perform its tasks

tests.title: EBS Backup Enabled
tests.description: Checks whether EBS Backup is enabled
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have backups in the form of snapshots.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each EBS volumes contain at least .

tests.title: ElasticSearch TLS Version
tests.description: Ensure ElasticSearch domain is using the latest security policy to only allow TLS v1.2
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured to enforce TLS version 1.2 for all clients to ensure encryption of data in transit with updated features.
tests.recommended_action: Update elasticsearch domain to set TLSSecurityPolicy to contain TLS version 1.2.

tests.title: Audit Manager Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that all data in Audit Manager is encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: All resource in AWS Audit Manager such as assessments, controls, frameworks, evidence are encrypted under a customer managed key or an AWS owned key, depending on your selected settings. If you don’t provide a customer managed key, AWS Audit Manager uses an AWS owned key to encrypt your content. Encrypt these resources using customer-managed keys in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Audit Manager data encryption settings and choose desired encryption key for data encryption

tests.title: Backup Vault Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon Backup vaults are using AWS KMS Customer Master Keys instead of AWS managed-keys (i.e. default encryption keys).
tests.more_info: When you encrypt AWS Backup using your own AWS KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) for enhanced protection, you have full control over who can use the encryption keys to access your backups.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Backup Vault with desired encryption level

tests.title: KMS Grant Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensure that AWS KMS key grants use the principle of least privileged access.
tests.more_info: AWS KMS key grants should be created with minimum set of permissions required by grantee principal to adhere to AWS security best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Create KMS grants with minimum permission required

tests.title: App Mesh Restrict External Traffic
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon App Mesh virtual nodes have egress only access to other defined resources available within the service mesh.
tests.more_info: Amazon App Mesh gives you controls to choose whether or not to allow App Mesh services to communicate with outside world. If you choose to deny external traffic, the proxies will not forward traffic to external services not defined in the mesh. The traffic to the external services should be denied to adhere to cloud security best practices and minimize the security risks.
tests.recommended_action: Deny all traffic to the external services

tests.title: App Mesh TLS Required
tests.description: Ensure that AWS App Mesh virtual gateway listeners only accepts TLS enabled connections.
tests.more_info: In App Mesh, Transport Layer Security (TLS) encrypts communication between the envoy proxies deployed on compute resources that are represented in App Mesh by mesh endpoints, such as Virtual nodes and Virtual gateways.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict AWS App Mesh virtual gateway listeners to accept only TLS enabled connections.

tests.title: DynamoDB Table Backup Exists
tests.description: Ensures that Amazon DynamoDB tables are using on-demand backups.
tests.more_info: With AWS Backup, you can configure backup policies and monitor activity for your AWS resources and on-premises workloads in one place. Using DynamoDB with AWS Backup, you can copy your on-demand backups across AWS accounts and regions, add cost allocation tags to on-demand backups, and transition on-demand backups to cold storage for lower costs.
tests.recommended_action: Create on-demand backups for DynamoDB tables.

tests.title: Backup Resource Protection
tests.description: Ensure that protected resource types feature is enabled and configured for Amazon Backup service within.
tests.more_info: Amazon Backup protected resource types feature allows you to choose which resource types are protected by backup plans on per-region basis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable protected resource type feature in order to meet compliance requirements.

tests.title: Backup In Use For RDS Snapshots
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Backup is integrated with Amazon Relational Database Service in order to manage RDS database instance snapshots
tests.more_info: Amazon RDS creates and saves automated backups of your DB instance during the backup window of your DB instance. With Amazon Backup, you can centrally configure backup policies and rules, and monitor backup activity for AWS RDS database instances.
tests.recommended_action: Enable RDS database instance snapshots to improve the reliability of your backup strategy.

tests.title: Backup Failure Notification Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Backup vaults send notifications via Amazon SNS for each failed backup job event.
tests.more_info: AWS Backup can take advantage of the robust notifications delivered by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS). You can configure Amazon SNS to notify you of AWS Backup events from the Amazon SNS console.
tests.recommended_action: Configure Backup vaults to sent notifications alert for failed backup job events.

tests.title: Backup Deletion Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that an Amazon Backup vault access policy is configured to prevent the deletion of AWS backups in the backup vault.
tests.more_info: With AWS Backup, you can assign policies to backup vaults and the resources they contain. Assigning policies allows you to do things like grant access to users to create backup plans and on-demand backups, but limit their ability to delete recovery points after they are created.
tests.recommended_action: Add a statement in Backup vault access policy which denies global access to action: backup:DeleteRecoveryPoint

data.name: 12.1.4 Data protection
data.description: Data protection functions, such as data access control and forgery prevention, should be provided to users.

tests.title: RDS Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, RDS instances should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance

tests.title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, Redshift clusters should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster

tests.title: SQS Cross Account Access
tests.description: Ensures SQS policies disallow cross-account access
tests.more_info: SQS policies should be carefully restricted to prevent publishing or reading from the queue from unexpected sources. Queue policies can be used to limit these privileges.
tests.recommended_action: Update the SQS policy to prevent access from external accounts.

tests.title: SQS Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected SQS queues will be enabled.

tests.title: Kinesis Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Kinesis Streams encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Data sent to Kinesis Streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all Kinesis Streams.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Kinesis streams will be enabled.

tests.title: SSM Encrypted Parameters
tests.description: Ensures SSM Parameters are encrypted
tests.more_info: SSM Parameters should be encrypted. This allows their values to be used by approved systems, while restricting access to other users of the account.
tests.recommended_action: Recreate unencrypted SSM Parameters with Type set to SecureString.

tests.title: Notebook Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure Notebook data is encrypted
tests.more_info: An optional encryption key can be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.
tests.recommended_action: An existing KMS key should be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.

tests.title: Lambda Public Access
tests.description: Ensures Lambda functions are not accessible globally
tests.more_info: The Lambda function execution policy should not allow public invocation of the function.
tests.recommended_action: Update the Lambda policy to prevent access from the public.

results.message: Function does not have an access policy
Function does not have an access policy

tests.title: Shield Protections
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is configured to protect account resources
tests.more_info: Once AWS Shield Advanced is enabled, it can be applied to resources within the account including ELBs, CloudFront.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced on resources within the account.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Public Access Block
tests.description: Ensures S3 public access block is enabled on all buckets or for AWS account
tests.more_info: Blocking S3 public access at the account level or bucket-level ensures objects are not accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the S3 public access block on all S3 buckets or for AWS account.

tests.title: ELBv2 Deletion Protection
tests.description: Ensures ELBv2 load balancers are configured with deletion protection.
tests.more_info: ELBv2 load balancers should be configured with deletion protection to prevent accidentaldeletion of live resources in production environments.
tests.recommended_action: Update ELBv2 load balancers to use deletion protection to prevent accidental deletion

tests.title: SQS Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQS queues are not publicly accessible
tests.more_info: SQS queues should be not be publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized actions.
tests.recommended_action: Update the SQS queue policy to prevent public access.

tests.title: VPC Endpoint Cross Account Access
tests.description: Ensures that Amazon VPC endpoints do not allow unknown cross account access.
tests.more_info: VPC endpoints should not allow unknown cross account access to avoid any unsigned requests made to the services inside VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Update VPC endpoint access policy in order to remove untrusted cross account access

tests.title: Lambda Environment Variables Client Side Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that all sensitive AWS Lambda environment variable values are client side encrypted.
tests.more_info: AWS Lambda lets you encrypt environment variable values prior to sending them to Lambda. Environment variables are often used to store sensitive information such as passwords. Such variable valuesshould be encrypted for security best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt environment variables that store sensitive information

tests.title: Workspaces IP Access Control
tests.description: Ensures enforced IP Access Control on Workspaces
tests.more_info: Checking the existence of IP Access control on Workspaces and ensuring that no Workspaces are open
tests.recommended_action: Enable proper IP Access Controls for all workspaces

tests.title: CloudFormation Stack Termination Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that AWS CloudFormation stacks have termination protection enabled.
tests.more_info: AWS CloudFormation stacks should have termination protection enabled to avoid accidental stack deletion.
tests.recommended_action: Enable termination protection for CloudFormation stack
tests.remediation_description: Stack termination protection will be enabled for affected stacks.

tests.title: RDS Deletion Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures deletion protection is enabled for RDS database instances.
tests.more_info: Deletion protection prevents Amazon RDS instances from being deleted accidentally by any user.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the RDS instances to enable deletion protection.

tests.title: Web Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures web access to the Apache Airflow UI in your MWAA environment is not public.
tests.more_info: To restrict access to the Apache Airflow UI, environment should be configured to be accessible only from within the VPC selected.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Amazon MWAA environments to set web server access mode to be private only

tests.title: SNS Cross Account Access
tests.description: Ensures SNS policies disallow cross-account access
tests.more_info: SNS topic policies should be carefully restricted to to subscribe or send messages. Topic policies can be used to limit these privileges.
tests.recommended_action: Update the SNS policy to prevent access from external accounts.

tests.title: Domain Privacy Protection
tests.description: Ensure that Privacy Protection feature is enabled for your Amazon Route 53 domains.
tests.more_info: Enabling the Privacy Protection feature protects against receiving spams and sharing contact information in response of WHOIS queries.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Privacy Protection for Domain

tests.title: S3 Glacier Vault Public Access
tests.description: Ensure that S3 Glacier Vault public access block is enabled for the account.
tests.more_info: Blocking S3 Glacier Vault public access at the account level ensures objects are not accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: Add access policy for the S3 Glacier Vault to block public access for the AWS account.

tests.title: SSM Documents Public Access
tests.description: Ensure that SSM service has block public sharing setting enabled.
tests.more_info: Public documents can be viewed by all AWS accounts. To prevent unwanted access to your documents, turn on the block public access sharing setting.
tests.recommended_action: Enable block public sharing setting under SSM  documents preferences.

tests.title: Kendra Index Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that the Kendra index is encrypted using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon Kendra encrypts your data at rest with AWS-manager keys by default. Use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create Kendra Index with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: Ledger Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS QLDB ledger is encrypted using desired encryption level
tests.more_info: QLDB encryption at rest provides enhanced security by encrypting all ledger data at rest using encryption keys in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).Use customer-managed keys (CMKs) instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create QLDB ledger with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Neptune Database Instance Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your AWS Neptune database instances are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keys.
tests.more_info: Neptune encrypted instances provide an additional layer of data protection by helping to secure your data from unauthorized access to the underlying storage. You can use Neptune encryption to increase data protection of your applications that are deployed in the cloud. You can also use it to fulfill compliance requirements for data-at-rest encryption.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Neptune database with desired encryption level

tests.title: MQ Broker Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon MQ brokers have data ecrypted at-rest feature enabled.
tests.more_info: Amazon MQ encryption at rest provides enhanced security by encrypting your data using encryption keys stored in the AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Enabled data at-rest encryption feature for MQ brokers

tests.title: Timestream Database Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Timestream databases are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keys.
tests.more_info: Timestream encryption at rest provides enhanced security by encrypting all your data at rest using encryption keys. This functionality helps reduce the operational burden and complexity involved in protecting sensitive data. With encryption at rest using customer-managed keys, you can build security-sensitive applications that meet strict encryption compliance and regulatory requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Timestream database encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: MemoryDB Cluster Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon MemoryDB cluster is encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: To help keep your data secure, MemoryDB at-rest encryption is always enabled to increase data security by encrypting persistent data using AWS-managed KMS keys. Use AWS customer-managed Keys (CMKs) instead in order to have a fine-grained control over data-at-rest encryption/decryption process and meet compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify MemoryDB cluster encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: MSK Cluster Encryption At-Rest
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Managed Streaming for Kafka (MSK) clusters are using desired encryption key for at-rest encryption.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK encrypts all data at rest using AWS-managed KMS keys by default. Use AWS customer-managed Keys (CMKs) instead in order to have a fine-grained control over data-at-rest encryption/decryption process and meet compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify MSK cluster encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: Project Artifacts Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your AWS CodeBuild project artifacts are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: AWS CodeBuild encrypts artifacts such as a cache, logs, exported raw test report data files, and build results by default using AWS managed keys. Use customer-managed key instead, in order to to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt them using customer-managed keys to gain more control over data encryption and decryption process.

tests.title: Pipeline Artifacts Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS CodePipeline is using desired encryption level to encrypt pipeline artifacts being stored in S3.
tests.more_info: CodePipeline creates an S3 artifact bucket and default AWS managed key when you create a pipeline.By default, these artifacts are encrypted using default AWS-managed S3 key. Use customer-managed key for encryption in order to to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure customer-manager keys (CMKs) are being used for CodePipeline pipeline artifacts.

tests.title: Translate Job Output Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon Translate jobs have CMK encryption enabled for output data residing on S3.
tests.more_info: Amazon Translate encrypts your output data with AWS-manager keys by default. Encrypt your files using customer-managed keys in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create Translate jobs with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: MSK Cluster Encryption In-Transit
tests.description: Ensure that TLS encryption within the cluster feature is enabled for your Amazon MSK clusters.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK in-transit encryption is an optional feature which encrypts data in transit within your MSK cluster. You can override this default at the time you create the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Enable TLS encryption within the cluster for all MSK clusters

tests.title: Backup Resource Protection
tests.description: Ensure that protected resource types feature is enabled and configured for Amazon Backup service within.
tests.more_info: Amazon Backup protected resource types feature allows you to choose which resource types are protected by backup plans on per-region basis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable protected resource type feature in order to meet compliance requirements.

tests.title: Backup Deletion Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that an Amazon Backup vault access policy is configured to prevent the deletion of AWS backups in the backup vault.
tests.more_info: With AWS Backup, you can assign policies to backup vaults and the resources they contain. Assigning policies allows you to do things like grant access to users to create backup plans and on-demand backups, but limit their ability to delete recovery points after they are created.
tests.recommended_action: Add a statement in Backup vault access policy which denies global access to action: backup:DeleteRecoveryPoint

tests.title: MSK Cluster Client Broker Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that only TLS encryption between the client and broker feature is enabled for your Amazon MSK clusters.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK in-transit encryption is an optional feature which encrypts data in transit between the client and brokers. Select the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to encrypt data as it travels between brokers and clients within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Enable only TLS encryption between the client and broker for all MSK clusters

tests.title: MSK Cluster Public Access
tests.description: Ensure that public access feature within the cluster is disabled for your Amazon MSK clusters.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK gives you the option to turn on public access to the brokers of MSK clusters running Apache Kafka 2.6.0 or later versions. For security reasons, you cannot turn on public access while creating an MSK cluster. However, you can update an existing cluster to make it publicly accessible.
tests.recommended_action: Check for public access feature within the cluster for all MSK clusters

tests.title: MSK Cluster Unauthenticated Access
tests.description: Ensure that unauthenticated access feature is disabled for your Amazon MSK clusters.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK authenticates clients to allow or deny Apache Kafka actions. Alternatively, TLS or SASL/SCRAM can be used to authenticate clients, and Apache Kafka ACLs to allow or deny actions.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that MSK clusters does not have unauthenticated access enabled.

tests.recommended_action: Ensure that storage volumes for ebs are encrypted using AWS keys or customer managed keys in Image recipe

tests.recommended_action: Modify Lambda functions to activate tracing

data.name: 12.3.1 Establishment of encryption policy
data.description: To protect data at rest or in transit in a cloud computing service, a policy concerning encryption targets, encryption strength (complexity), key management, and password use, should be established. It should be ensured that the policy reflects legal requirements relating to encryption, such as encrypting personal data when it is stored or transmitted.

tests.title: Insecure Ciphers
tests.description: Detect use of insecure ciphers on ELBs
tests.more_info: Various security vulnerabilities have rendered several ciphers insecure. Only the recommended ciphers should be used.
tests.recommended_action: Update your ELBs to use the recommended cipher suites

tests.title: RDS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for RDS instances which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the databases.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: CloudTrail Encryption
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail encryption at rest is enabled for logs
tests.more_info: CloudTrail log files contain sensitive information about an account and should be encrypted at rest for additional protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail log encryption through the CloudTrail console or API
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Cloud trails will be enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for Redshift clusters which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Encrypted AMI
tests.description: Ensures EBS-backed AMIs are configured to use encryption
tests.more_info: AMIs with unencrypted data volumes can be used to launch unencrypted instances that place data at risk.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all AMIs have encrypted EBS volumes.

tests.title: EBS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume is used for a root volume, the instance must be launched from an AMI that has been encrypted as well.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for EBS volumes.

tests.title: SQS Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected SQS queues will be enabled.

tests.title: EBS Encrypted Snapshots
tests.description: Ensures EBS snapshots are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS snapshots should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume was not encrypted and a snapshot was taken the snapshot will be unencrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Configure volume encryption and delete unencrypted EBS snapshots.

tests.title: Kinesis Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Kinesis Streams encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Data sent to Kinesis Streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all Kinesis Streams.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Kinesis streams will be enabled.

tests.title: Firehose Delivery Streams Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Firehose Delivery Stream encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Data sent through Firehose Delivery Streams can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing delivery streams can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all Firehose Delivery Streams.

tests.title: SSM Encrypted Parameters
tests.description: Ensures SSM Parameters are encrypted
tests.more_info: SSM Parameters should be encrypted. This allows their values to be used by approved systems, while restricting access to other users of the account.
tests.recommended_action: Recreate unencrypted SSM Parameters with Type set to SecureString.

tests.title: Notebook Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure Notebook data is encrypted
tests.more_info: An optional encryption key can be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.
tests.recommended_action: An existing KMS key should be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.

tests.title: DynamoDB KMS Encryption
tests.description: Ensures DynamoDB tables are encrypted using a customer-owned KMS key.
tests.more_info: DynamoDB tables can be encrypted using AWS-owned or customer-owned KMS keys. Customer keys should be used to ensure control over the encryption seed data.
tests.recommended_action: Create a new DynamoDB table using a CMK KMS key.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted DynamoDB table will be configured to use either KMS encryption with AWS managed CMK, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: EFS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that EFS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EFS offers data at rest encryption using keys managed through AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Encryption of data at rest can only be enabled during file system creation. Encryption of data in transit is configured when mounting your file system. 1. Backup your data in not encrypted efs 2. Recreate the EFS and select 'Enable encryption of data at rest'

tests.title: Workgroup Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Athena workgroups are configured to encrypt all data at rest.
tests.more_info: Athena workgroups support full server-side encryption for all data at rest which should be enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption at rest for all Athena workgroups.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected workgroups will be enabled.

tests.title: RDS Snapshot Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for RDS snapshots to ensure encryption of data at rest.
tests.more_info: AWS provides encryption for RDS snapshots which should be enabled to ensure that all data at rest is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Copy the snapshot to a new snapshot that is encrypted and delete the old snapshot.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensures object encryption is enabled on S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 object encryption provides fully-managed encryption of all objects uploaded to an S3 bucket.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CMK KMS-based encryption for all S3 buckets.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted bucket will be configured to use either AES-256 encryption, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Encrypted Domain
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are encrypted with KMS
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be encrypted to ensure data at rest is secured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure encryption-at-rest is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be encrypted with KMS.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Node To Node Encryption
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domain traffic is encrypted in transit between nodes
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should use node-to-node encryption to ensure data in transit remains encrypted using TLS 1.2.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure node-to-node encryption is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to use node-to-node encryption.

tests.title: XRay Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CMK-based encryption is enabled for XRay traces.
tests.more_info: AWS XRay supports default encryption based on an AWS-managed KMS key as well as encryption using a customer managed key (CMK). For maximum security, the CMK-based encryption should be used.
tests.recommended_action: Update XRay encryption configuration to use a CMK.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected XRay traces will be enabled.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Enforce Object Encryption
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket policies do not allow uploads of unencrypted objects
tests.more_info: S3 bucket policies can be configured to block uploads of objects that are not encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket policy to deny uploads of unencrypted objects.

tests.title: DMS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures DMS encryption is enabled using a CMK
tests.more_info: Data sent through the data migration service is encrypted using KMS. Encryption is enabled by default, but it is recommended to use customer managed keys.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS CMKs for all DMS replication instances.

tests.title: Amazon Comprehend Volume Encryption
tests.description: Ensures the Comprehend service is using encryption for all volumes storing data at rest.
tests.more_info: Comprehend supports using KMS keys to encrypt data at rest, which should be enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Enable volume encryption for the Comprehend job

tests.recommended_action: Enable output result encryption for the Comprehend job

tests.title: DynamoDB Accelerator Cluster Encryption
tests.description: Ensures DynamoDB Cluster Accelerator DAX clusters have encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: DynamoDB Clusters Accelerator DAX clusters should have encryption at rest enabled to secure data from unauthorized access.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for DAX cluster.

tests.title: EMR Encryption In Transit
tests.description: Ensures encryption in transit is enabled for EMR clusters
tests.more_info: EMR clusters should be configured to enable encryption in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Update security configuration associated with EMR cluster to enable encryption in transit.

tests.title: EMR Encryption At Rest
tests.description: Ensures encryption at rest for local disks is enabled for EMR clusters
tests.more_info: EMR clusters should be configured to enable encryption at rest for local disks.
tests.recommended_action: Update security configuration associated with EMR cluster to enable encryption at rest for local disks.

tests.title: SNS Topic CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Amazon SNS topics are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: AWS SNS topics should be  encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keysin order to have a more granular control over the SNS data-at-rest encryption and decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Update SNS topics to use Customer Master Keys (CMKs) for Server-Side Encryption.

tests.title: RDS CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys(CMKs).
tests.more_info: RDS instances should be encrypted with Customer Master Keys in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with KMS CMK encryption enabled.

tests.title: RDS Transport Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures RDS SQL Server instances have Transport Encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: Parameter group associated with the RDS instance should have transport encryption enabled to handle encryption and decryption
tests.recommended_action: Update the parameter group associated with the RDS instance to have rds.force_ssl set to true

tests.title: SNS Topic Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures that Amazon SNS topics enforce Server-Side Encryption (SSE)
tests.more_info: SNS topics should enforce Server-Side Encryption (SSE) to secure data at rest. SSE protects the contents of messages in Amazon SNS topics using keys managed in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Enable Server-Side Encryption to protect the content of SNS topic messages.
tests.remediation_description: Server-Side Encryption to protect the content of SNS topic messages will be enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Cluster CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are encrypted using KMS customer master keys (CMKs)
tests.more_info: KMS CMKs should be used to encrypt redshift clusters in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
tests.recommended_action: Update Redshift clusters encryption configuration to use KMS CMKs instead of AWS managed-keys.

tests.title: EFS CMK Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure EFS file systems are encrypted using Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: EFS file systems should use KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed keys for encryption in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
tests.recommended_action: Encryption at rest key can only be configured during file system creation. Encryption of data in transit is configured when mounting your file system. 1. Backup your data in not encrypted efs 2. Recreate the EFS and use KMS CMK for encryption of data at rest.

tests.title: EBS Encryption Enabled By Default
tests.description: Ensure the setting for encryption by default is enabled
tests.more_info: AWS account should be configured to enable encryption for new EBS volumes and snapshots for all regions.
tests.recommended_action: Enable EBS Encryption by Default

tests.title: EKS Secrets Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures EKS clusters are configured to enable envelope encryption of Kubernetes secrets using KMS.
tests.more_info: Amazon EKS clusters should be configured to enable envelope encryption for Kubernetes secrets to adhere to security best practice for applications that store sensitive data.
tests.recommended_action: Modify EKS clusters to enable envelope encryption for Kubernetes secrets

tests.title: AWS Glue S3 Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that encryption at-rest is enabled when writing AWS Glue data to Amazon S3.
tests.more_info: AWS Glue should have encryption at-rest enabled for Amazon S3 to ensure security of data at rest and to prevent unauthorized access.
tests.recommended_action: Recreate AWS Glue Security Configuration to enable Amazon S3 encryption at-rest

tests.title: AWS Glue Data Catalog CMK Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures that AWS Glue has data catalog encryption enabled with KMS Customer Master Key (CMK).
tests.more_info: AWS Glue should have data catalog encryption enabled with KMS Customer Master Key (CMK) instead of AWS-managed Key in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Glue data catalog to use CMK instead of AWS-managed Key to encrypt Metadata

tests.title: AWS Glue Job Bookmark Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that AWS Glue job bookmark encryption is enabled.
tests.more_info: AWS Glue security configuration should have job bookmark encryption enabled in order to encrypt the bookmark data before it is sent to Amazon S3.
tests.recommended_action: Recreate Glue security configurations and enable job bookmark encryption

tests.title: Lambda Environment Variables Client Side Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that all sensitive AWS Lambda environment variable values are client side encrypted.
tests.more_info: AWS Lambda lets you encrypt environment variable values prior to sending them to Lambda. Environment variables are often used to store sensitive information such as passwords. Such variable valuesshould be encrypted for security best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt environment variables that store sensitive information

tests.title: WorkSpaces Volume Encryption
tests.description: Ensures volume encryption on WorkSpaces for data protection.
tests.more_info: AWS WorkSpaces should have volume encryption enabled in order to protect data from unauthorized access.
tests.recommended_action: Modify WorkSpaces to enable volume encryption

tests.title: AWS Glue CloudWatch Encrypted Logs
tests.description: Ensures that encryption at-rest is enabled when writing AWS Glue logs to Amazon CloudWatch.
tests.more_info: AWS Glue should have encryption at-rest enabled for AWS Glue logs to ensure security of AWS Glue logs.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Glue Security Configurations to enable CloudWatch logs encryption at-rest

tests.title: AWS Glue Data Catalog Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that AWS Glue Data Catalogs has encryption at-rest enabled.
tests.more_info: Encryption should be enabled for metadata objects stored in your AWS Glue Data Catalog to secure sensitive data.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Glue data catalog settings and enable metadata encryption
tests.remediation_description: Glue data catalog encryption for the affected regions will be enabled.

tests.title: Secrets Manager Encrypted Secrets
tests.description: Ensures Secrets Manager Secrets are encrypted
tests.more_info: Secrets Manager Secrets should be encrypted. This allows their values to be used by approved systems, while restricting access to other users of the account.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Secrets Manager Secrets

tests.title: ElasticSearch Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that AWS ElasticSearch domains have encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be encrypted to ensure that data is secured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure encryption-at-rest is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.

tests.title: ECR Repository Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that the images in ECR repository are encrypted using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: By default, Amazon ECR uses server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed encryption keys which encrypts your data at rest using an AES-256 encryption algorithm. Use customer-managed keys instead, in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create ECR Repository with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: Kendra Index Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that the Kendra index is encrypted using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon Kendra encrypts your data at rest with AWS-manager keys by default. Use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create Kendra Index with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: Environment Template Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Proton environment template is encrypted with desired level.
tests.more_info: AWS Proton encrypts sensitive data in your template bundles at rest in the S3 bucket where you store your template bundles using AWS-managed keys. Use customer-managed keys (CMKs) in order to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Create Proton environment template with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: ElastiCache Redis Cluster Encryption In-Transit
tests.description: Ensure that your AWS ElastiCache Redis clusters have encryption in-transit enabled.
tests.more_info: Amazon ElastiCache in-transit encryption is an optional feature that allows you to increase the security of your data at its most vulnerable points—when it is in transit from one location to another.
tests.recommended_action: Enable in-transit encryption for ElastiCache clusters

tests.title: SES Email Messages Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon SES email messages are encrypted before delivering them to specified buckets.
tests.more_info: Amazon SES email messages should be encrypted in case they are being delivered to S3 bucket to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for SES email messages if they are being delivered to S3 in active rule-set .

tests.title: Ledger Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS QLDB ledger is encrypted using desired encryption level
tests.more_info: QLDB encryption at rest provides enhanced security by encrypting all ledger data at rest using encryption keys in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).Use customer-managed keys (CMKs) instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create QLDB ledger with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Environment Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS MWAA environment data is encrypted
tests.more_info: Amazon MWAA encrypts data saved to persistent media with AWS-manager keys by default. Use customer-managed keys instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create MWAA environments with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: Neptune Database Instance Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your AWS Neptune database instances are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keys.
tests.more_info: Neptune encrypted instances provide an additional layer of data protection by helping to secure your data from unauthorized access to the underlying storage. You can use Neptune encryption to increase data protection of your applications that are deployed in the cloud. You can also use it to fulfill compliance requirements for data-at-rest encryption.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Neptune database with desired encryption level

tests.title: MQ Broker Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon MQ brokers have data ecrypted at-rest feature enabled.
tests.more_info: Amazon MQ encryption at rest provides enhanced security by encrypting your data using encryption keys stored in the AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Enabled data at-rest encryption feature for MQ brokers

tests.title: Connect Customer Profiles Domain Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Connect Customer Profiles domains are using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Customer profiles domain is a container for all data, such as customer profiles, object types, profile keys, and encryption keys. To encrypt this data, use a KMS key with desired encrypted level to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Enabled data encryption feature for Connect Customer Profiles

tests.title: CloudWatch Log Groups Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that the CloudWatch Log groups are encrypted using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Log group data is always encrypted in CloudWatch Logs. You can optionally use AWS Key Management Service for this encryption. After you associate a customer managed key with a log group, all newly ingested data for the log group is encrypted using this key. This data is stored in encrypted format throughout its retention period. CloudWatch Logs decrypts this data whenever it is requested.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure CloudWatch Log groups have encryption enabled with desired AWS KMS key

results.message: The cloudwatch log group is whitelisted.

tests.title: Timestream Database Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Timestream databases are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keys.
tests.more_info: Timestream encryption at rest provides enhanced security by encrypting all your data at rest using encryption keys. This functionality helps reduce the operational burden and complexity involved in protecting sensitive data. With encryption at rest using customer-managed keys, you can build security-sensitive applications that meet strict encryption compliance and regulatory requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Timestream database encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: MemoryDB Cluster Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon MemoryDB cluster is encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: To help keep your data secure, MemoryDB at-rest encryption is always enabled to increase data security by encrypting persistent data using AWS-managed KMS keys. Use AWS customer-managed Keys (CMKs) instead in order to have a fine-grained control over data-at-rest encryption/decryption process and meet compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify MemoryDB cluster encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: MSK Cluster Encryption At-Rest
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Managed Streaming for Kafka (MSK) clusters are using desired encryption key for at-rest encryption.
tests.more_info: Amazon MSK encrypts all data at rest using AWS-managed KMS keys by default. Use AWS customer-managed Keys (CMKs) instead in order to have a fine-grained control over data-at-rest encryption/decryption process and meet compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify MSK cluster encryption configuration to use desired encryption key

tests.title: ElastiCache Redis Cluster Encryption At-Rest
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon ElastiCache Redis clusters are encrypted to increase data security.
tests.more_info: Amazon ElastiCache provides an optional feature to encrypt your data saved to persistent media. Enable this feature and use customer-managed keys In order to protect it from unauthorized access and fulfill compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for ElastiCache cluster data-at-rest

tests.title: Service Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS App Runner service is encrypted using using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: To protect your application's data at rest, App Runner encrypts all stored copies of your application source image or source bundle using AWS-managed key by default.Use customer-managed keys (CMKs) instead in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create App Runner Service with customer-manager keys (CMKs)

tests.title: FinSpace Environment Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS FinSpace Environments are using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon FinSpace is a fully managed data management and analytics service that makes it easy to store, catalog, and prepare financial industry data at scale.To encrypt this data, use a KMS key with desired encrypted level to meet regulatory compliance requirements within your organization.
tests.recommended_action: Create FinSpace Environment with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: Project Artifacts Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that your AWS CodeBuild project artifacts are encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: AWS CodeBuild encrypts artifacts such as a cache, logs, exported raw test report data files, and build results by default using AWS managed keys. Use customer-managed key instead, in order to to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt them using customer-managed keys to gain more control over data encryption and decryption process.

tests.title: Pipeline Artifacts Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS CodePipeline is using desired encryption level to encrypt pipeline artifacts being stored in S3.
tests.more_info: CodePipeline creates an S3 artifact bucket and default AWS managed key when you create a pipeline.By default, these artifacts are encrypted using default AWS-managed S3 key. Use customer-managed key for encryption in order to to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure customer-manager keys (CMKs) are being used for CodePipeline pipeline artifacts.

tests.title: HealthLake Data Store Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that AWS HealthLake Data Store is using desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: Amazon HealthLake is a Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR)-enabled patient Data Store that uses AWS-managed KMS keys for encryption. Encrypt these data stores using customer-managed keys (CMKs) in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Create HealthLake Data Store with customer-manager keys (CMKs).

tests.title: CodeArtifact Domain Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures that AWS CodeArtifact domains have encryption enabled with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: CodeArtifact domains make it easier to manage multiple repositories across an organization. By default, domain assets are encrypted with AWS-managed KMS key. Encrypt them using customer-managed keys in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt CodeArtifact domains with desired encryption level

tests.title: Audit Manager Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that all data in Audit Manager is encrypted with desired encryption level.
tests.more_info: All resource in AWS Audit Manager such as assessments, controls, frameworks, evidence are encrypted under a customer managed key or an AWS owned key, depending on your selected settings. If you don’t provide a customer managed key, AWS Audit Manager uses an AWS owned key to encrypt your content. Encrypt these resources using customer-managed keys in order to gain more granular control over encryption/decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Audit Manager data encryption settings and choose desired encryption key for data encryption

tests.title: DocumentDB Cluster Encrypted

tests.description: Ensure that field-level encryption is enabled for your Amazon CloudFront web distributions.
tests.more_info: With Amazon CloudFront, you can enforce secure end-to-end connections to origin servers by using HTTPS. tests.recommended_action: Enable only TLS encryption between the client and broker for all MSK clusters
